description: An introductory course to HTML for beginners, covering essential concepts for creating web pages.

lessons.title: Introduction to HTML
lessons.content:
Welcome to HTML Basics for Beginners! In this lesson, we'll cover the basics of HTML (Hypertext Markup Language). HTML is the standard markup language used for creating web pages. We'll learn about the structure of HTML documents, elements, tags, and attributes. As an example, let's create a simple HTML document with the basic structure: My First Web Page

Hello, World!

This is a paragraph.

In this example, we used different HTML tags to create headings, paragraphs, and the basic structure of the document.

tests.question: What is HTML?
What is the purpose of HTML?
options: To add interactivity to web pages

lessons.title: HTML Forms
lessons.content: Forms are used to collect user input on web pages. In this lesson, we'll learn how to create forms using HTML. We'll explore form elements such as text fields, radio buttons, checkboxes, select dropdowns, and submit buttons. We'll also discuss form validation and handling form data. lessons.title: HTML Audio and Video
lessons.content:
In modern web development, audio and video content plays a significant role. In this lesson, we'll learn how to embed audio and video files using HTML5. We'll explore the <audio> and <video> tags and their attributes for specifying media sources, controls, and playback options. Let's see an example of embedding audio and video:

<audio controls>
  <source src="audio.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
  Your browser does not support the audio element.
</audio>

<video width="320" height="240" controls>
  <source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video element.
</video>
